intro: Bupleurum balansae var. longiradiatum, commonly known as the long-rayed bupleurum, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often hollow stems. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbel-like clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its rarity and specific ecological requirements, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
